poem:
### Truth Patrol

In cobbled streets where shadows play,  
amidst echoing cries on stormy nights,  
words are woven, tangled webs of light;  
It's not the force in uniform, baton bold,  
but gentle voices trusted old,  
who untangle rumors, balm to fright,  
binding truth and whispering peace,  
in quiet corners of this fractured isle.
